body_html:
The problem is that x and u have different ranks and can not multiply.
You should define x, u as follows:
x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=(batch_size, 1795,13))
u=tf.Variable(tf.truncated_normal(shape=(batch_size, 13,5), stddev=0.1))
y=tf.matmul(x,u)
#where batch_size is the size of one batch.

The problem is that x and u have different ranks and can not multiply.
You should define x, u as follows:
x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=(batch_size, 1795,13))
u=tf.Variable(tf.truncated_normal(shape=(batch_size, 13,5), stddev=0.1))
y=tf.matmul(x,u)
#where batch_size is the size of one batch.
body:
The problem is that x and u have different ranks and can not multiply.
You should define x, u as follows:
x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=(batch_size, 1795,13))
u=tf.Variable(tf.truncated_normal(shape=(batch_size, 13,5), stddev=0.1))
y=tf.matmul(x,u)
#where batch_size is the size of one batch.
